title: Invalid AlphaType obtained from DecodeBounds method
body:
### Description

Hi, I'm trying to use SkiaSharp to merge a few images. To do that I was trying to create a surface using `SKImageInfo` obtained from the first image but the resulting image was brighter than I expected.
It turned out that `AlphaType` for the same image that comes from `DecodeBouns` is different than `AlphaType` that comes from `Decode` method. When I used an `AlphaType` that comes from the `Decode` method then everything started to work.

### Code

```C#
var firstImageInfo = SKBitmap.DecodeBounds(firstImageDataSource.ImageData); // ImageData is type of SKData
var firstImage = SKBitmap.Decode(firstImageDataSource.ImageData);
```

### Expected Behavior

`firstImageInfo.AlphaType == firstImage.Info.AlphaType`

### Actual Behavior

`firstImageInfo.AlphaType` is different than `firstImage.Info.AlphaType`

### Basic Information

- Version with issue:  1.60.3
- Last known good version:  <!-- the version of SkiaSharp that still working -->
- IDE:  Rider
- Platform Target Frameworks: .NET Core 2.0
  - Windows Classic:  Windows 10
- Target Devices:
  - PC
